info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 23 at 4:20PM MST until September 23 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, southwestern Cochise.
* WHEN...Until 615 PM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 420 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... San Pedro River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sierra Vista, Fort Huachuca and Ramsey Canyon Preserve. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MST THIS EVENING
